saf.core.ui.dock

Interface DockableFrame

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultDockableFrame

    public interface DockableFrame
    Interface for classes that implement a dockable frame.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToolBar(javax.swing.JToolBar bar)
      Adds a toolbar to this frame.
      void close()
      Close this dockable.
      void close(java.lang.String perspectiveID)
      Closes this dockable in the specified perspective.

      Floats this DockableFrame.

      Returns the value of the property with the specified key.

      Gets the panel that contains the component displayed in this frame.
      java.lang.String getID()
      Gets the unique id for this DockableFrame.
      java.lang.String getTitle()
      Gets the title text for this DockableFrame.

      Gets the toolbar, if any, for this frame.

    • Method Detail

      • putClientProperty

        void putClientProperty(java.lang.Object key,
                     java.lang.Object value)
        Adds an arbitrary key/value "client property" to this component.
        Parameters:
        key - the new client property key
        value - the new client property value; if this is null the property will be removed

      • getClientProperty

        java.lang.Object getClientProperty(java.lang.Object key)
        Returns the value of the property with the specified key. Only properties added with putClientProperty will return a non-null value.
        Parameters:
        key - the property key whose value should be returned.
        Returns:
        the value of the property with the specified key.

      • getToolBar

        javax.swing.JToolBar getToolBar()
        Gets the toolbar, if any, for this frame.
        Returns:
        the toolbar for this frame if one exists, otherwise null.

      • addToolBar

        void addToolBar(javax.swing.JToolBar bar)
        Adds a toolbar to this frame.
        Parameters:
        bar - the toolbar to add

      • getContentPane

        javax.swing.JPanel getContentPane()
        Gets the panel that contains the component displayed in this frame. By default this component can be retrieved by calling getComponent(0) on the returned panel.

        Note that this panel should not contain the toolbar.

        Returns:
        the panel that contains the component displayed in this frame.

      • isMinimized

        boolean isMinimized()
        Gets whether or not this DockableFrame is minimized.
        Returns:
        true if this DockableFrame is minimized, otherwise false.

      • isMaximized

        boolean isMaximized()
        Gets whether or not this DockableFrame is maximized.
        Returns:
        true if this DockableFrame is maximized, otherwise false.

      • isFloating

        boolean isFloating()
        Gets whether or not this DockableFrame is floating.
        Returns:
        true if this DockableFrame is floating, otherwise false.

      • getID

        java.lang.String getID()
        Gets the unique id for this DockableFrame.
        Returns:
        the unique id for this DockableFrame.

      • getTitle

        java.lang.String getTitle()
        Gets the title text for this DockableFrame.
        Returns:
        the title text for this DockableFrame.

      • setTitle

        void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets the title text for this DockableFrame.
        Parameters:
        title - the title text for this DockableFrame.

      • toFront

        void toFront()
        Selects this DockableFrame.

      • restore

        void restore()
        Restores this DockableFrame.

      • minimize

        void minimize(DockingManager.MinimizeLocation location)
        Minimizes this DockableFrame.
        Parameters:
        location - the location to minimize to

      • maximize

        void maximize()
        Maximizes this DockableFrame.

      • doFloat

        void doFloat()
        Floats this DockableFrame.

      • close

        void close()
        Close this dockable. Assumes the dockable is in the current perspective.

      • close

        void close(java.lang.String perspectiveID)
        Closes this dockable in the specified perspective.
        Parameters:
        perspectiveID - the id of the perspective to close the dockable in.
